name: Chicken Liver Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'chicken livers'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shallots'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'clove garlic'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dry sherry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'heavy cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}
steps: Trim chicken livers of any membrane, dry on paper towels, and set aside.. Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shallots and garlic, and saute until softened, about 3 minutes.. Add chicken livers, thyme, sherry, salt, and pepper to the pan, and increase temperature to medium-high. Cook, stirring occasionally, until livers are just turning light pink in the center, 3 to 4 minutes. If you’re unsure how cooked the livers are, cut one in half to check.. Transfer to a food processor. Add heavy cream, remaining 4 tablespoons butter, and nutmeg, and blend until very smooth, adding a little more cream if necessary to reach a good spreading consistency.. Transfer to a bowl, cover, and refrigerate until firm, at least 3 hours or overnight.. Serve in ramekins or small jars, and garnish as desired.

name: Liver Pâté
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'chicken livers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cooking sherry'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground mace'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Combine livers and sliced onion in a medium saucepan. Pour in about 3 cups water and bring to a boil.. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until liver is tender, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).. Remove from heat and drain. Discard sliced onion, and remove and discard any hard portions of the livers.. Process cooked livers in a food processor until smooth.. Add butter, chopped onion, sherry, butter, salt, pepper, and mace; pulse to blend.. Form mixture into a mound with lightly greased hands. Place onto a serving platter; cover and chill for 1 hour before serving.

name: Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'braunschweiger liver sausage'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: In a medium bowl, mix braunschweiger liver sausage, cream cheese, onion, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Form into a ball shape. Wrap with plastic wrap. Chill in the refrigerator at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Chef John's Pate de Campagne
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'duck leg meat'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'fatty bacon, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'chicken livers, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'yellow onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'shallot, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped Italian parsley'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cognac'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pink curing salt (such as Instacure™ #1) (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cherries (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shelled whole pistachios (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'strips', 'name': 'bacon, or as needed'}
steps: Combine cloves, nutmeg, ginger, and cayenne pepper in a small bowl to make spice mixture.. Place pork shoulder, duck meat, chopped bacon, chicken livers, onion, shallot, parsley, cognac, salt, garlic, pepper, 3/4 teaspoon spice mixture, and pink curing salt in a large bowl. Mix thoroughly until evenly distributed. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate about 2 hours.. Whisk cream, bread crumbs, and eggs together in a bowl.. Transfer pork mixture to a rimmed baking sheet lined with a silicone mat or parchment. Freeze for 15 to 20 minutes to facilitate grinding the meat.. Grind pork mixture into a bowl using the meat-grinder attachment of a stand mixer. Add dried cherries and pistachios. Add the cream mixture; fold gently until just combined.. Arrange bacon strips crosswise in a 9x5-inch loaf pan, letting ends hang over the edges of the pan. Trim some strips to fit the ends of the pan.. Fill pan to the top with the ground pork mixture; smooth the top. Cover surface with strips of bacon. Fold side bacon piece edges over the top. Cover with a piece of parchment cut to fit the top of the pan; wrap tightly with heavy duty aluminum foil.. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Transfer pan to a deep pot or Dutch oven. Pour in hot tap water to reach 1/2 to 2/3 of the way up the side of the pan. Cover.. Bake in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 155 degrees F (68 degrees C), 1 3/4 to 2 hours.. Transfer pan to a paper-towel lined surface to absorb any moisture. If mixture has risen above the top edge of the pan, press it down with a heavy pan. Remove the aluminum foil, leaving the parchment paper on top. Transfer pan to a paper-towel-lined baking dish. Cut a piece of cardboard to be slightly smaller than the top of the pan. Wrap with aluminum foil and place on the parchment paper. Press down with weights like canned food.. Refrigerate at least 8 hours to chill and compress the pate.. To unmold the pate, pour very hot water into a large bowl. Dip mold into hot water for 1 to 2 seconds. Turn out onto a paper-towel-lined dish; chill again before slicing.

name: Exotic Mushroom and Walnut Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced shallots'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'shiitake mushrooms, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'crimini mushrooms, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'portobello mushrooms, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'roasted garlic puree'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh Italian parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread walnuts in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Toast for 10 minutes, or until fragrant and lightly browned.. In a large saute pan, cook shallots in butter over medium heat until translucent. Then add chopped mushrooms, garlic, parsley, thyme, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring often, until most of the liquid has evaporated.. Process toasted walnuts and olive oil in a blender or food processor until mixture forms a thick paste. Spoon in the cooked mushroom mixture, and process to desired texture.. Pack mixture into well-oiled ramekins or bowl. Cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for a few hours or overnight.

name: Gorton (French-Canadian Pork Spread)
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'finely ground pork fat'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'finely ground pork'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and black pepper to taste'}
steps: Stir pork fat, ground pork, onions, water, cloves, and nutmeg together in a large pot. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the pork is tender, at least 1 ½ hours. Use a potato masher to mash the pork mixture every 15 minutes as it cooks. The longer you simmer the gorton, the better the flavor will be. Add water as needed to keep the mixture from boiling dry. When you're ready to stop cooking, let the liquid reduce as much as possible without letting it burn.. Refrigerate gorton overnight. Remove and discard the fat layer, or stir it into the meat for a creamier spread.

name: Mock Chopped Liver
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lentils'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cubes', 'name': 'vegetable or chicken bouillon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Place water, lentils, and bouillon cubes in a pot; cover and simmer over medium heat until tender, about 30 minutes. Drain well.. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; add onion and sauté until soft and translucent.. Blend cooked lentils, onions, and walnuts in a food processor until it reaches the desired consistency for pâté. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Chill before serving.

name: Chicken Liver Pâté
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'chicken livers, trimmed and chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dry sherry'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'hot sauce to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in garlic, onion, and chicken livers. Reduce heat to low, and sauté until chicken livers are tender and no longer pink, about 10 minutes.. Place chicken liver mixture in a blender; add dry sherry, cream cheese, hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth; transfer to a medium bowl. For best results, cover and chill pâté in the refrigerator for approximately 2 hours before serving.

name: Veggie Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sunflower seeds'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole wheat flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'nutritional yeast'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'potato, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrot, peeled and sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried thyme'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried sage'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried savory'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground dry mustard'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8x8 inch baking dish.. In a food processor, blend sunflower seeds, whole wheat flour, nutritional yeast, salt, vegetable oil, lemon juice, potato, carrot, onion, celery, garlic, water, thyme, basil, sage, savory, pepper and dry mustard. Process the mixture until almost smooth.. Transfer mixture to the baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven 1 hour, or until bubbly and lightly browned.

name: Easy Liver Pâté
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'Braunschweiger (a liver sausage), pork'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'finely chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}
steps: Mix together sausage, cream cheese, milk, and onion in a medium bowl. Season with Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, sugar, and garlic, and mix until well blended.. Wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, until firm.

name: French-Canadian Gorton Pork Spread
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'lean pork butt, cut into pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and black pepper to taste'}
steps: Place pork, onion, cinnamon, and clove into a saucepan. Season with salt and pepper. Pour in enough water to just cover pork. Bring to a boil.. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until water has nearly evaporated, about 1 hour. Stir occasionally to ensure pork cooks evenly.. Use a potato masher or wire whisk to break pork into thin strands. Pour off any remaining liquid, then spoon gorton into a serving bowl. Refrigerate until cold before serving.

name: Red Salmon Pâté
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(7 ounce) can', 'name': 'salmon, drained, flaked and bones removed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'prepared horseradish'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'grated onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped pecans (Optional)'}
steps: In a medium bowl, mix together salmon, cream cheese, horseradish, lemon juice, and onion. Chill if necessary until firm enough to handle, then form into a ball. Roll in parsley and pecans if desired. Refrigerate until serving. Serve with assorted crackers.

name: Salmon Terrine
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce)', 'name': 'fresh salmon fillet'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'smoked salmon, chopped'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh tarragon, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'black pepper'}
steps: Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan and add salt. Add salmon fillet, reduce to a simmer, and cook until just cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer salmon to a plate using a slotted spoon and let cool 10 minutes. Flake salmon into a large bowl, discarding skin, and toss with smoked salmon, green onion, parsley, and tarragon.. Whisk together butter, mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice, and pepper in a bowl until smooth. Add mayonnaise mixture to salmon mixture and gently stir until well combined.. Cover and chill 3 hours. Serve with toasted baguette slices or crackers.

name: Turkey Liver Pate (Fois Gras)
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'turkey liver'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy cream'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground white pepper'}
steps: Place stock in a heavy pan; add salt and bring to a boil. Gently add liver with a spoon and return to a boil.. Reduce heat and simmer until liver is completely opaque in color, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove liver from the pan and let sit for 5 minutes.. Put liver into a food mixer. Add cream, a little at a time, and process until smooth. Season with pepper. Chill before serving, if desired.

name: Easy Chicken Liver Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tart apple - peeled, cored, and quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'chicken livers, rinsed and trimmed'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brandy'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter, melted'}
steps: Set aside 1/2 cup butter to soften slightly.. Place onion and apple in a food processor with the steel knife blade; process until coarsely chopped.. Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and apple; cook and stir until lightly browned, 5 to 10 minutes. Return onion and apple to food processor.. Melt 5 tablespoons butter in the same skillet over high heat; cook chicken livers until browned and just done inside, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and pour in brandy; allow to warm up without stirring. Carefully light the liquid; let flames subside.. Transfer chicken liver mixture to the food processor with onion and apple. Add cream and process until very smooth. Transfer mixture into a bowl and refrigerate until cool, at least 30 minutes.. Cut the softened 1/2 cup butter into pieces and process in the food processor; add about 1/3 of the liver mixture and blend about 5 seconds. Repeat 2 more times with remaining liver mixture. Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper and blend well.. Transfer pate to a serving dish or several small dishes; top with 1 tablespoon melted butter. Cover loosely with plastic wrap; refrigerate until chilled and set, about 3 hours.

name: Colleen's Chicken Liver Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'chicken livers, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cold unsalted butter, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'whole black peppercorns, divided'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, smashed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'Scotch whiskey'}
steps: Combine chicken livers and milk in a bowl. Let soak in the refrigerator, about 2 hours.. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until soft, about 5 minutes. Add 1 1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns, garlic, red pepper flakes, and thyme; cook and stir until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.. Remove chicken livers from the milk with a slotted spoon; add to the saucepan with balsamic vinegar and bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until chicken livers are tender and no longer pink, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly, 5 to 10 minutes.. Transfer chicken liver mixture to a food processor. Add remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons black peppercorns and Scotch; blend until smooth. Add remaining 6 tablespoons of butter and pulse until fully incorporated into the mixture.. Divide blended mixture evenly among 6 porcelain ramekins. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm, about 6 hours.

name: Danish Chicken Liver Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'water, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'chicken livers, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Preheat oven to 390 degrees F (200 degrees C).. Mix flour and water together in a bowl until a thin paste forms, adding more water as needed.. Combine flour mixture, chicken livers, cream, onion, eggs, butter, salt, nutmeg, and black pepper in a food processor; process until blended and smooth, 30 to 45 seconds.. Transfer liver mixture to three 7x4-inch disposable pans. Cover pans with aluminum foil and place in a baking pan. Pour enough water into the baking pan to come up halfway up the sides.. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil and continue baking until cooked through, about 25 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Cool to room temperature. Cover with lids and refrigerate.

name: 7 Chicken Liver Pâté Recipes That'll Impress Your Guests
Bug Lady Tofu Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'name': 'soft tofu'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'prepared mustard'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'seasoning salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'nutritional yeast'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange bell pepper, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh red chile pepper, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh dill weed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}
steps: Wrap soft tofu in cheese cloth. Place over a medium bowl, and press to drain as much liquid as possible.. Place tofu in a medium bowl. Mix in mayonnaise, garlic powder, white pepper, mustard, seasoning salt, nutritional yeast, paprika, orange bell pepper, red chile pepper, celery, parsley, cilantro, dill weed and garlic. Blend until smooth. Cover and chill in the refrigerator until serving.

name: To Die For Garlic Feta Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'anchovy fillets, chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled feta cheese'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco™), or to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Combine the garlic, anchovies, butter, cream cheese, feta cheese, sour cream, chives, hot pepper sauce and pepper in the container of a food processor. Process until smooth. Transfer to a serving bowl, and serve with crackers, bread slices, or pita chips.

name: Special Occasion Smoked Bluefish Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'skinless, boneless smoked bluefish'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'prepared Dijon-style mustard'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'prepared horseradish'}
steps: Break up smoked bluefish and place in a food processor with cream cheese. Use pulse setting to blend smooth. Mix in prepared Dijon-style mustard and horseradish. Blend to desired consistency. Increase amounts of mustard and horseradish, if desired. Cover and chill in the refrigerator 6 hours, or overnight, before serving.

name: White Bean Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'butter, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'shallot, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cannellini (white kidney) beans, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dry sherry'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'melted butter'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley, or as desired'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'paprika, or as desired'}
steps: Lightly grease a serving bowl with butter.. Pour olive oil into a skillet; add white pepper, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper. Place the skillet over medium heat and warm the spices until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.. Stir shallot into the warm oil and spices; cook and stir until the shallot begins to change color, 3 to 5 minutes.. Stir cannellini beans and tomato paste into the shallot and spice mixture. Cook and stir while mashing the beans thoroughly, about 5 minutes.. Stir sherry and soy sauce through the mashed bean mixture; cook until the liquid evaporates, 1 to 2 minutes.. Remove the skillet from heat. Stir melted butter through the bean mixture; season with salt. Pack the bean mixture into the prepared bowl.. Chill in refrigerator at least 1 hour; garnish with parsley and paprika to serve.

name: Lighter Cretons
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground turkey'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sage'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(.25 ounce) package', 'name': 'unflavored gelatin (such as Knox ®)'}
steps: Place ground turkey, 1 cup water, onion, cloves, sage, and cinnamon in a saucepan. Bring turkey mixture to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 45 minutes, mashing ingredients occasionally with a spatula while cooking; remove from heat.. Stir gelatin into remaining 1/2 cup water; stir gelatin mixture into turkey mixture. Transfer to a small container; refrigerate until cool, about 1 hour.

name: 9 Rich Pâté Recipes for Elegant Entertaining
Chicken Liver Pate with Currants
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried currants'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'chicken livers, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried thyme'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Place currants in a small bowl; cover with orange liqueur. Let soak until plump, about 1 hour.. Melt 1/4 cup butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic in the hot butter until softened, about 1 minute. Add chicken livers; cook and stir until no longer pink in the center, 5 to 8 minutes.. Place remaining 3/4 cup butter, chicken liver mixture, heavy cream, thyme, and allspice in a food processor; blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and stir in currants and orange liqueur. Season pate with salt and pepper.. Divide pate among small ramekins. Refrigerate until firm, at least 3 hours.

name: George's Salmon-Pepper Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'cooked salmon fillet'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Greek yogurt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried dill weed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'French bread, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'prepared jalapeno pepper jelly, or to taste'}
steps: Blend salmon, Greek yogurt, salt, and dill weed together in a food processor until creamy and smooth. Refrigerate pate until set, at least 1 hour.. Butter each slice of bread and toast in the toaster oven, about 4 minutes. Spread salmon pate over bread; spread pepper jelly on top.

name: Rustic Chicken Liver and Morel Pate
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'warm milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cognac'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ounce', 'name': 'dried morel mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'chicken livers, rinsed and trimmed'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'cubed, fully cooked ham'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground pork'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'bay leaf'}
steps: Combine milk, cognac, and morel mushrooms in a bowl; soak for 20 minutes.. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease a terrine mold.. Combine chicken livers, ham, and garlic in a food processor. Process until mixture is smooth and well combined. Add ground pork, egg, pepper, and salt. Process again until smooth and well combined.. Drain morel mushrooms and and chop; stir mushrooms into the meat mixture. Tip pate mixture into the prepared terrine mould. Smooth out mixture with the back of a spoon and gently press bay leaf on top.. Bake in the preheated oven until pate has set, about 1 hour. Remove from oven and allow to cool to room temperature. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours before serving
